value.title: Introduction to data analytics on Azure
value.excerpt: Introduction to data analytics on Azure

topItems.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
topItems.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

topItems.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.

topItems.title: Explore data analytics at scale
topItems.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Manage workspaces and datasets in Power BI
value.excerpt: Once you have created your Power BI data sets and reports, it’s time to deploy them so the users can take advantage of all of your hard work. In this Learning Path, you will learn how to create workspaces in the Power BI service. You will deploy your Power BI artifacts here and share them to your users. You will also learn how to connect Power BI reports to on-premise data sources. Your users will appreciate seeing the latest data in your reports, so you will configure automatic refresh for your Power BI datasets. Row-level security allows you to create one report, but have users be restricted to see only the data that applies to them. This targets data to users, without having to create multiple reports.

topItems.title: Create and manage workspaces in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This module explains how you can share reports and datasets with your users and how to create a deployment strategy that makes sense for you and your organization. Furthermore, you will learn about data lineage in Microsoft Power BI.

topItems.title: Manage datasets in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: With Microsoft Power BI, you can build multiple reports from a single dataset, meaning that if you change the dataset, all reports will be updated with that change. Additionally, you can clean and prep data once rather than repeatedly for each report.

topItems.title: Implement row-level security
topItems.excerpt: Row-level security (RLS) allows you to create a single or a set of reports that targets data for a specific user. In this module, you will learn how to implement RLS by using either a static or dynamic method and how Microsoft Power BI simplifies testing RLS in Power BI Desktop and Power BI service.

value.title: Create and manage workspaces in Power BI
value.excerpt: This module explains how you can share reports and datasets with your users and how to create a deployment strategy that makes sense for you and your organization. Furthermore, you will learn about data lineage in Microsoft Power BI.

value.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
value.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

value.title: Get started with data warehouses in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Understand the key components and design considerations for implementation of data warehouses in Microsoft Fabric.

value.title: Perform analytics in Power BI
value.excerpt: You will learn how to use Power BI to perform data analytical functions, how to identify outliers in your data, how to group data together, and how to bin data for analysis. You will also learn how to perform time series analysis. Finally, you will work with advanced analytic features of Power BI, such as Quick Insights, AI Insights, and the Analyze feature.

value.title: Scope report design requirements
value.excerpt: Gathering appropriate inputs to scope your report design requirements involves identifying your audience, determining the suitable report types, and defining their interface and experience requirements. This module provides you with a strong foundation on which to learn how to plan your report design requirements.

value.title: Structure analytical report designs in Power BI
value.excerpt: Designing an analytical report involves understanding the requirements and its audience. However, designing a compelling analytical report requires understanding the automatic and unconscious processes that occur when report consumers comprehend what they see. When you have the knowledge of how to structure and apply report design principles, you can raise the level of your report designs to produce relevant, intuitive, and visually pleasing experiences for your report consumers.

value.title: Embed Power BI content
value.excerpt: Learn about embedding Power BI content.

value.title: Enforce data permissions for Power BI embedded analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to enforce data permissions for Power BI embedded analytics.

value.title: Set up permissions to embed Power BI content
value.excerpt: Learn which settings and permissions to use for internal and external users of your app with embedded Power BI content.

value.title: Implement row-level security
value.excerpt: Row-level security (RLS) allows you to create a single or a set of reports that targets data for a specific user. In this module, you will learn how to implement RLS by using either a static or dynamic method and how Microsoft Power BI simplifies testing RLS in Power BI Desktop and Power BI service.

value.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
value.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.
